summary: Internal Deutsche Bank email chain regarding a KYC (Know Your Customer) case assignment for Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a need for approval to onboard him and an escalation regarding a felony. The document is marked confidential pursuant to Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e).

persons.name: Amanda Kirby
persons.context: Deutsche Bank employee emailing about a KYC case for Jeffrey Epstein, apologizing for delays and forwarding information.

persons.name: Armen Brash
persons.role: Anti-Money Laundering Business Risk, Deutsche Asset & Wealth Management
persons.context: Deutsche Bank AML employee requesting approval to onboard Jeffrey Epstein and needing to escalate to Pat Harris regarding a felony.

persons.name: Pat Harris
persons.context: Mentioned as being part of earlier discussions and the person to whom an escalation regarding a felony needs to be made.

persons.name: Chip
persons.context: Mentioned as the person whose approval is needed to onboard Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a Deutsche Bank KYC (Know Your Customer) annual review case, with a noted need for approval and an escalation regarding a felony.

connections.description: Deutsche Bank colleagues corresponding about a KYC case assignment and procedures.
Armen Brash indicates a need to escalate a matter regarding a felony to Pat Harris.
Armen Brash requests Chip's approval to onboard Jeffrey Epstein as a customer.
Deutsche Bank staff are processing a KYC review for customer Jeffrey Epstein, with concerns about a felony.

events.title: KYC Case Assignment for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A KYC (Know Your Customer) annual review case is assigned within Deutsche Bank for customer Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Request for Onboarding Approval and Felony Escalation
events.description: Armen Brash emails Amanda Kirby requesting Chip's approval to onboard Jeffrey Epstein and stating a need to escalate to Pat Harris regarding a felony.

events.title: Email Forwarding and Apology
events.description: Amanda Kirby replies to Armen Brash, apologizing for delay, forwarding the requested information, and noting Pat Harris was part of earlier discussions.

keyFacts: Deutsche Bank had an active KYC (Know Your Customer) review case for Jeffrey Epstein in August 2013.
Bank staff identified a need to escalate the matter regarding a felony to a manager named Pat Harris.
Approval from an individual named 'Chip' was required to onboard Jeffrey Epstein as a customer.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL - PURSUANT TO FED. R. CRIM. P. 6(e)', indicating it relates to grand jury secrecy rules.
Internal bank communications show procedural steps and concerns around maintaining Jeffrey Epstein as a customer.
